content.description:
Route follows right arete/face up to roof/bulge, then traverses left along the roof towards the dihedral/anchors to finish.

Unprotected swing if falls happen on the arete.

Most sustained movements on formation.
content.location: Right of Tail Direct, starting with hands around the arete.

content.description:
Route follows the thin crack line that runs up the face and through the dihedral.

This route does take marginal gear if so inclined
content.protection:
TR, anchor station

What I used :

#3 nut, #2 TCU, Gray Alien, .75 C4
content.location: Route left of Tail Direct (same dihedral finish)

content.description: Start from the V shaped slab directly under first bolt. Find the hands and high step to get settled. Head direct up towards bulge for a tad more tricky beta, or trend left after 2nd bolt for easier finish. Continue up the dihedral to anchors.
content.location:
Tail Direct starts going straight (directly) up the V slab ramp to gain the first bolt, and continues up the bolt line. It's the only bolted route on the formation with a very distinct dihedral at the top section.

A little further beyond

Showcase Rock

but before

Lummox Rock

.
